main event: A civilian UFO report was submitted in accordance with AFR 200-2A. Observers aboard a Dutch merchant vessel named Collyto reported a round, reddish-orange object approximately three feet in diameter with a steaming tail of gaseous flame. The object was observed for a total of 5 minutes, 1 minute, and 45 seconds, and was on a westward course at an elevation of approximately 7560 feet.
interesting points: The object was described as round, reddish-orange, and approximately three feet in diameter with a steaming tail of gaseous flame, displaying no sound.

It was observed by ground visual using binoculars and was reported as having a collision course with the ship before making a gradual right turn and resuming the original course before disappearing over the horizon.
The first observer used 7x50 binoculars, and the second observer used 10x50 binoculars.
The observers were crewmen aboard the Dutch merchant vessel Collyto, and the visibility was reported as 20 miles with a wind beaufort of 2-3 west.
The ship's altitude varied from the surface to 50,000 feet, and the object's altitude was reported at approximately 7560 feet with an azimuth of approximately 153 degrees.
sighted object: Round, reddish-orange object with a steaming tail of gaseous flame
location: Approximately 60 Miles East of Puerto Rico
witnesses: Civilian observers aboard the Dutch merchant vessel Collyto
